title: Merchandising Specialist
content:
About us 





Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 5,000,000 active users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.
Over 30,000 global brands and small businesses, including H&M, Adidas, IKEA, SHEIN, noon, and Bloomingdale’s, use Tabby’s technology to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering flexible payments online and in stores. Tabby is active in Saudi Arabia, UAE, Egypt and Kuwait and backed by leading investors, including Sequoia Capital India, STV, PayPal Ventures, Mubadala Investment Capital, Arbor Ventures and others.






 
The role
We are looking for an enthusiastic bright individual to join the team at Tabby to assist with the online merchandising of the full range of products across Tabby marketplace
The Merchandising Specialist will play a significant role in driving sales and conversion, by creating a best-in-class customer experience on site, must have a knowledge of designer brands, products and key trends, coupled with the understanding of customer needs to help maximize conversion & BNPL revenue
What you’ll do

Maintain thorough product knowledge on current and upcoming product assortment to build out new campaigns & collections for tabby shop
Support merchandising ops team to create and import product feeds for all incoming product
Support merchandising ops team to manage all product details, descriptions, titles, images and categorisation with accuracy
Collaborate with CRM team to create and implement push & email marketing schedule
Browse app daily for quality assurance and address issues immediately with relevant stakeholders
Conduct periodic review of search terms in order to optimistic collection building
Work closely with product data team to set and optimise towards core marketplace metrics
You’ll work with others in the team to create innovative work by coming up with campaign ideas using the Tabby’s product canvas (i.e. BNPL, Marketplace, Cards)
Responsible for maintaining an optimal app navigation and user experience

Qualifications

2+ years of experience in merchandising fashion ecommerce
Commercially aware with sales focus to help maximize conversion & revenue
Must be detail-orientated, deadline-driven, and able to multi-task with solid organisational and time-management skills
Energized by working cross-functionally with technical and commercial teams
Passion for experimentation and innovation
Exceptional communication and presentation skills required
Proactive and highly motivated team player
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, highly entrepreneurial environment with multiple different stakeholders

Preferred Qualifications

You are a scrappy, insightful, and innovative problem solver & self-starter
You are part creative strategist, part storyteller, and a results-oriented creative marketing expert
You have a proven track record of taking ownership and driving results on creative projects
You bring conceptual excellence to the work, inspiring clients and team members to raise the creative bar
You regularly push your comfort zone to stretch and improve yourself, never thinking “that’s not my job”
You are passionate about technology, advertising, marketing, and are always keeping up with it

What you can expect

We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in company’s employee stock options program.
Health Insurance

We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow and meet their goals (whatever they may be).
If this sounds exciting to you, we’d love to hear from you!
